description: Unknown. Possibly a contraction of ho, boy or the dialectal English term hawbuck (“lout, clumsy fellow, country bumpkin”).

entries.meaning: (Canada, US) A wandering homeless person, especially (historical) one illegally travelling by rail or (derogatory) a penniless, unemployed bum.
(Canada, US) Any migratory laborer, whether homeless or not.

examples: Avoid bulky styles such as duffle sacks, buckets, doctors' satchels, and hobos.

verbs.description: hobo (third-person singular simple present hobos, present participle hoboing, simple past and past participle hoboed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, perhaps pejorative) To be a hobo, tramp, bum etc.
examples: Joe idly hoboed through half the country till he realized hoboing never gets you anywhere in life.
